roleset.name: to make timid, fill with fear

example.name: transitive
example.text: Congress learned during the Reagan administration that it could intimidate the executive branch by [*-1] uttering again and again the same seven words : `` Provided , that no funds shall be spent [*-48] ... . ''
example.arg: by [*-1] uttering again and again the same seven words : `` Provided , that no funds shall be spent [*-48]

roleset.note: Frames file for 'intimidate' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus; adjectival 'timid' based on BOLT-6. Member of Vncls amuse-31.1

example.name: adjectival rel: timid
example.text: . As soon as you browbeat us , it instead makes us feel that your hearts are quite empty / timid / hesitant ,
